snippet: SWADOS--Elizabeth. February 5, 1951-January 5, 2016. Artist, mentor, composer. Cherished wife of Roz Lichter. Culture has lost a great one but heaven will now rock with the music of her soul. Thank you to the doctors and nurses and staff at Cornell Weill and NYU Langone. A memorial service is being planned. In lieu of flowers, contributions in Liz's memory may be made to the Educational Advocacy Project at the Legal Aid Society ("Legal Aid Society- EAP") or the Jewish Women's Archive. "She shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water that brings forth the fruit in season, whose leaves shall not wither." 1/3
lead_paragraph: SWADOS--Elizabeth. February 5, 1951-January 5, 2016. Artist, mentor, composer. Cherished wife of Roz Lichter. Culture has lost a great one but heaven will now rock with the music of her soul. Thank you to the doctors and nurses and staff at Cornell Weill and NYU Langone. A memorial service is being planned. In lieu of flowers, contributions in Liz's memory may be made to the Educational Advocacy Project at the Legal Aid Society ("Legal Aid Society- EAP") or the Jewish Women's Archive. "She shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water that brings forth the fruit in season, whose leaves shall not wither." 1/3
